title: Ping has slowly kept going up over the past few months?
body: Since I've started playing league where I live now, my ping has slowly just started going up over the years. Before the server moved I used to get 40 ping. Which that was around a year or so ago? At the moment I currently get 96 and it DOES NOT drop below this at all. Even if I have nobody home on the internet it doesn't go below that. Around 10 months ago I used to get around 60 ping. Then around 6 months ago I used to get 86 and it wouldn't drop below that. Now I am stuck at 96 and it doesn't go below that. I would love to find a way to make my ping drop atleast to 60 again. The game is very hard to play atm because this ping is rather unbearable.

replies.body:
Latency (ping) is the measure of how long it takes for your connection to hit the servers. This is almost entirely impacted by your ISP routing and nodes your connection travels along to get to the server. We can certainly take a look at your route, but we first need to ensure your local network settings and compatible by having you check out the [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) we've written up.

Let me know if you continue to see your current latency numbers after making those changes.
